## Data loading {.smaller}
```{python}
import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_csv('smoker.csv')
df
```

## Histogram

### Single variable
```{python}
df['smoker'].hist()
```

---

### All variables
```{python}
df.hist();
```

## Data loading {.smaller}
```{python}
import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_csv('customer_data.csv')
df
```

## Line chart

### One Variable
```{python}
df['Age'].plot()
```

### All variables
```{python}
df.plot();
```

### All Variables, log scale for y axis
```{python}
df.plot(logy = True)
```

## Scatter plot

### Two variables

#### Method 1
```{python}
df.plot(kind='scatter', x = 'Income', y = 'Age')
```

#### Method 2
```{python}
df.plot.scatter(x = 'Income', y = 'Age')
```

### All variables

#### Dataset


```{python}
import seaborn as sns
df = sns.load_dataset("iris") 
df
```


```{python}
sns.pairplot(df, hue = 'species');
```


```{python}
sns.pairplot(df, hue = 'species');
```
